reviewText:
What happens when you combine Ponies, Unicorns, Pegasus', Breezeies (bug like ponies with wings and antennae) and dragons? You get some wild adventures that teach lessons like being true to yourself, compromising, and taking responsibility for your actions.
Many of these episodes are hard to find, so this collection is a good deal and essential for any My Little Pony lover.

This 2 Disc DVD set contains 4 classic My Little Pony movies. Amazon doesn't always do a good job on their DVD descriptions so here are the movies that are included in this DVD set:

1. Princess Promenade - Wysteria and Pinkie Pie meet Spike the sleeping dragon who crowns someone a new princess.
2. Dancing In The Clouds - Twinkle Twirl needs a great idea to help come up with a dance for the Friendship Ball.
3. Runaway Rainbow - An accident finds Rarity teleported to another land.  Can she be rescued in time to make the first rainbow of the season?
4. Friends Are Never Far Away - Can everyone in Ponyville and Butterfly Island become friends?

I got this classic version of MLP because my daughter is so into the new age version that I wanted her to see what I grew up with, plus I wanted to watch them too :)  My daughter was not as interested but she did watch and will randomly ask to view them again.  I loved them on the other hand.  So many memories!

As long as my daughter is happy

OK, strictly speaking, I DON'T love it.  MY GRAND-DAUGHTER LOVES IT.  She can watch these darn things over and over and over again.
OK what age group, you ask?  Well, she liked it at age 3, still loves it age 4, and it probably has a couple more years to run with her.  The colors are splendid, the music is happy, the voices are cute, the lessons are gentle.  It even soothed our youngest grandson age 4 months, when he was (I think) colicky and ABSOLUTELY NOTHING ELSE could soothe him---the Pretty Ponies did the trick.  Honest.  Like.....magic.  Didn't put him to sleep--just had him fascinated!

Princess Promenade and The Runaway Rainbow are among the best of G3's animation with only the separately released A Very Minty Christmas and Twinkle Wish Adventure rivaling them.  Friends Are Never Far Away is only decent but is good worldbuilding for things like A Very Minty Christmas. Dancing in the Clouds is actually sorta subpar but is probably required since it takes place before Friends Are Never Far Away.  The problem comes from all this not being in chronological order.  G3 has a pretty clear continuity until it gets rebooted for the Core 7 revamp, yet the movies seem to just be randomly packaged on the discs.  There's a lot more sing-a-longs that could have been on here than there was.  Perhaps the most glaring omission is that the mini episode Greetings From Unicornia was left out of the collection...despite being really short and actually being a pack-in with the original DVD release.  The menus don't seem optimized for a computer since many of the titles require you to click an icon on the side instead of clicking the text directly.

Despite some of the issues, it's still good to have this and the price is quite reasonable.  Hopefully, Shout Factory will release the rest of G3 along with G1 and My Little Pony Tales.
Super cute! Glad we bought it for our little girls. We've had to watch it several times already, sure they'll watch it more yet

These videos are very sweet. The best is "The Runaway Rainbow". We like the implied mythology of the Pegasus Ponies in this version. The relationship between Star Catcher and her magic butterflies is a source of endless speculation between me and my 6yo.  We have some books that seem to feature the butterflies sans Star Catcher as well- very mysterious! Friendship is Magic it ain't, but this era definitely has its own charm.
